titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid of the UW-Milwaukee Urban Studies Programs, 1956-2011

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department
publicationstmt.date: Copyright © 2007 University of Wisconsin Board of Regents

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Dan Vinson

change.item: Brad Houston made some additional changes to the contents list and arrangement, scopecontent, and processinfo notes.
Phyllis Reske updated the finding aid to reflect minimal processing of accession 2010-065. Changes were made to the extent, abstract, scope and content, arrangement, and contents list.

Brad Houston updated the finding aid to reflect minimal processing of accession 2011-027 and to update the name of the department. Changes were made to titleproper, unittitle, extent, abstract, bioghist, and the contents list.
Hayley Jackson updated the finding aid, adding information about new, unprocessed accessions.

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: Documents from the Urban Studies Programs, formerly the Department of Urban Affairs. The collection mainly consist of meeting minutes, correspondence, program reviews, syllabi files dating from 1981 to 2011, and records related to the Ford Foundation, which awarded the Department of Urban Affairs an early research grant. Also included are documents relating to the establishment of the Department and academic planning documents, including proposals for a doctoral program and a Master of Public Administration.

bioghist.p: The Department of Urban Affairs was established in 1963 within the College of Letters and Science. In 1965 an Urban Studies Program was established within the Department of Urban Affairs for undergraduates participating in the following majors: economics, geography, political science, and sociology. The Urban Planning program was established within the Department of Urban Affairs in Spring of 1975. The department was subsumed into Urban Studies Programs in 1987, although a separate Master of Science in Urban Affairs was still offered until 1993.

bioghist.head: Department Chairs, Department of Urban Affairs

scopecontent.p: The collection contains documents from the Urban Research Committee's proposals for the urban studies program, and an outline of a proposed 5-10 year urban studies department program. Also included are course proposals within the History Department, and proposals for undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degree programs in Urban Studies, an Urban Affairs Department, a joint degree program with the School of Education or the School of Information Studies, and a master's of public administration program. Program reviews, and records regarding the Ford Foundation, which awarded a research grant in December 1959, are in the collection, along with minutes from the Department of Urban Affairs, which consist of various memos and announcements relating to courses, staffing, budgets and other departmental functions. Course syllabi, student recruitment and program event posters, program brochures, and several issues of the Intrapost, Urban Affairnewspaper, and USI News are also included.

arrangement.p: The collection was received in, and is organized in, multiple parts. Although some additional materials have been physically and/or intellectually arranged and interfiled, researchers may need to consult more than one part of the collection to locate similar materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

archref.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee College of Letters & Science Records

accessrestrict.p: The records in boxes 10-12 contain student information and are restricted under the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 (FERPA). Please see an archivist for more information.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: An unknown donor transferred the collection to the Archives prior to 1989. Accession 2010-065 was donated by an unknown donor in June 2011. The Urban Studies Program donated accession 2011-027 in December 2011.

processinfo.p: Meredith Curtis processed the collection at the Archives in April-May 1994. Thomas Steman added box four to the collection in January 1996. Hayley Jackson updated the finding aid to include information about accessions 2010-065 and 2011-027 in October 2013. Phyllis Reske processed Accessions 2010-065 and 2011-027 in February 2017 (Brad Houston supervised).
